instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only one side is getting 5V 033Amps
threads.message:
Hi, 

Got this board without any damage. Suddenly stopped working one side pf USB C (J3300) No V no Amps. Other side is getting 5.15V and 0.32 amps. 


<CHIP>U3200</CHIP>... and this four components may cause this kind? Before this when it was CD issue i always was getting at least 5V on all ports. 

Visual checking on logic board have no issue, nothing burnt. 


Can T2 fail this way? 

No rails found shorted to ground. 


On J3300 when connect there is absolutly nothing on board, no voltage anyware.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only one side is getting 5V 033Amps
threads.message:
T2 failure cannot cause different behaviour on USB-C ports.
There should be something wrong on affected area.

Check voltage and diode mode to ground on all LDO outputs of <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>/200.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only one side is getting 5V 033Amps
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL> is shorted to ground. Will continue checking about this and report once finish. Thank you
